intro: Mussaenda thorelii, commonly known as the yellow mussaenda, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange inflorescences that resemble clusters of small flowers. The plant has simple, opposite, and often hairy leaves that are elliptical in shape. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. Mussaenda thorelii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant blooms and compact growth habit.
